なぜこんなアプデをしてしまったのか、理解に苦しみます。 バグや動作の重さはしばらくしたら改善されるだろうと数年間我慢して来きましたが、アプデ前のようなサクサクした動作には一向に戻りませんし、未だにバグだらけ（今ちょうど、ノートが閉じれないバグが発生した所です）。パッと見はモダンになったかもしれないけれど、UXは遥かに劣化しました。 もう、時間の問題では無いのでしょう。今の運営の能力ではこのアプリを良くする事は出来ないのだと思います。今年のサブスクリプションが切れたら別のサービスに移行しようと思います。 追記：ノートを編集すると、文量によって数分から数十分まともにアプリが使えなくなり、そのノートも同期に時間がかかるのか開けません。また、かなり頻繁に編集のコリジョンがおきます。致命的なバグが増えるとは、どんな開発をしているのか想像もできません。早く別のアプリに移行したいです。

This is an excellent app for dictation. It allows me to write when I'm on the treadmill, making dinner, or any other tasks that I can do while speaking. 非常非常糟糕的經驗，我在Google上沒有給過一星的評價，但是這次我要破例。 這是一個沒有誠信的公司，對於客戶的問題的態度是不予理會。 我是一個老用戶，一開始是直接在官方網站註冊並且繳費，也都是使用個人電腦錄音因為線上會議，當時是用月訂閱制有6000分鐘的時間。在漲價之後原本的6000分鐘縮減到1200分鐘，所以我必須要升級我的方案才有足夠的錄音時間，這些都沒問題，我也願意升級到年訂閱的方案。 隨著疫情趨緩，我開始實體的會議，所以開始用手機錄音比較多，我想就直接在手機上升級我的方案，因為是同樣的帳號。我在2023年1月1日升級到年訂閱，到期日期應該是2024年1月1日，看繳費證明是透過Google收費，目前我的Google訂閱也是顯示到期日期是2024年。 然而可能因為一開始使用的官網月訂閱沒有取消，所以我在2023年1月2號的時候，被官網收取了月訂閱的費用，而且我的訂閱到期時間從2024年1月1日變成2023年2月2日，被覆蓋過去了，等於我在手機上升級年訂閱的錢被吃掉了。 第一封信跟客服反應的結果是讓我一直等待，沒有進一步的回覆，這讓我超過Google退款時間，第二封信也沒回應。

It general, it's a nice app to mess with -- but the more I use it, the more I find it too clumsy to tackle my needs. For example, if you back out of a note, you should get a warning that your scribble is going to be lost...(uggh). I got lucky and somehow was able to pinch and zoom in -- but I have not been able to replicate something so simple. Clearly it's there -- somewhere, but not where would expect it to be consistently (e.g., everywhere would be nice for larger screen users like me). While you can re-size the note background, and scale the content to size -- you cannot move the block of content to make resizing the note more functional. Nor change the pen inking width (that I could find). Moving notes about -- it is very crude feeling for more serious matters. I have yet to find any 'gestures' to rotate notes, but I did find the 90-degree flip... (not like in the demo with slight rotations). I like the idea of the widget on my Fold3, but I find the integration to the main app to be just to awkward to use. It has plenty of potential -- any maybe buried or hidden functionality waiting for a spelunker. I am also sure it's great in select scenarios/use-cases. Overall, it is cute, but awkward. It stumbles as I tried to use it more... Also, some type of sync across devices would be helpful. The plumbing is already in, so provide an option to move the data to a cloud store (many to choose from) to support multiple devices. All in all, some cool stuff, light feel; but misses in a lot of places. I look forward to seeing where it goes a few iterations down the road.

Signals greatest strength was, in my opinion, SMS support. It allowed people to simply install Signal on their less tech savvy relatives phones as the default SMS app and they'd get secure communication for free when both parties had it. Now they will simply default back to insecure communication because you aren't going to teach them to use multiple apps when they just want to "send a message". I barely have contacts on Signal now and I really have to reevaluate if it's worth keeping at all.

Initial impression: it is appalling that events are lost forever, if they occur during a period when the hub has no internet connection! Response to Samsung: no need to contact you - the retailer has confirmed the behaviour. If the hub has no internet at the time of an event, that event will never be logged in the cloud, even after the network has been re-established. The hub will simply discard it. (automations will still work however, assuming the local IoT network is still functioning)

Niantic has utterly lost touch with its player base, causing frustration and disappointment by prioritizing their alleged values over the gaming experience. The recent changes have rendered Pokemon GO virtually unplayable for those with jobs or other commitments, who cannot afford to sprint through town for every raid. This is a massive letdown for loyal fans who have dedicated years to the game. The sense of betrayal runs deep, and it's disheartening to see such disregard for the community.

A forthcoming update has made it all too clear that the company who develops this game, Niantic, is only interested in its players' personal GPS data. They are manipulating game mechanics to coerce the players to play the game a certain way which maximizes the type of GPS data other companies will pay big $$$ for. So, if you are interested in your privacy and not being used as Niantic's tool, please find another game to play.

I've played since launch and enjoyed the experience for a while. In the last year, Niantic has become openly hostile toward the player base. Raising prices while giving less for the money. Events are not fun anymore. Corporate greed and out of touch management have ruined the game.

The developers are not interested in the player base and are making the game more and more inaccessible for those with disabilities and/or impairments. Recent price rises have been the final nail in the coffin for many and the game is slowly losing support whilst damaging the Pokemon companies' reputation.

The game is staying afloat solely on the back of the massive Pokémon franchise. Predatory box prices, poorly coded events and timers, severely outdated Ul, price increases, boring events, and Elite Raid mechanics are just a few issues facing the game and all the problems stem from Niantics complete lack of awareness or care of their player base. recommend not downloading this game until that changes.

Ever since lockdown ended, Niantic have been taking away the things they added during it, and then some, making the game much more inaccessible for those with full time jobs, those who are disabled, those who live in rural areas, etc. The game is in an awful state right now, often failing to load properly, and with players being alienated by the developers more and more with each update. Don't let it being a Pokémon game fool you. Do not download this game until Niantic sort themselves out.

The game mechanics are simple and accessible, and the game itself is fun. Past a certain point, though, card balance becomes problematic and the rate of acquisition grinds to a complete standstill. Once you hit Pool 3, you either have the top-tier cards or you lose -- and whether or not you obtain those powerful cards from a lootbox is up to pure luck. In short, good game to pick up for a few weeks while everybody only has starter decks, but unwelcoming and grindy over the long-term.

It is, however, a bit predatory with its bundles being WAY too expensive; this turns acquiring new cards into a massive grind after hitting a certain collector level. Outside of the massive money grab tactics there is a game to be enjoyed; it's just hard to see it when it's hidden behind $60 bundles.

Uses pictures to try and teach you words. Does not tell you what anything means. So you have to guess what the sentences are trying to say. After a bunch of wrong guesses do you somewhat understand what the previous lesson was trying to teach. If I had to write or speak the language on my own, I'd be SOL.

The pictures (1/8"x1/8") are too small to see, even on my Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra. I just guess most of the time, resulting in not being able to complete every lesson (reading lesson in particular). Everything else is awesome, but those pics that CANNOT be enlarged or zoomed in are THE WORST. At $100+ annual subscription, Rosetta Stone could do MUCH better. Response: Thank you for that information. I wish I would have known sooner. All the more reason to review on Google.

No doubt the best brain training app available on the Play store. It's great for keeping fresh, training, and building knowledge in key areas that are useful in everyday life - spelling, grammar, reading, discounting, etc. It even has extra study materials with tips and tricks to improve in these areas.

It really helps you gain more skill, and I like the daily lesson schedule it gives you. The only downside is that there are only three lessons and you need to pay the subscription which I think is overpriced. Overall though I think this app is pretty cool and is actually helping me hone in on my reading, writing, and math.

It's fun and educational. Packed with knowledge needed in your everyday life, it helps you master things without having to get help from the outside. Mastering grammar and math, improving your reading skills... it's an amazing app that doesn't even require a lot of time to play. Even though you don't get as much with the free version, it's still a great pick in terms of brain sharpening games.
